result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J. Fischer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution has been paid in full from cash bond previously posted.

Pay costs on each count of the action.  Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

records.addlTxt: Door County Restitution Summary
Door County Restitution Summary

Defendant Joshua J. Fischer in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend Count 1 to criminal trespass to dwelling, Count 3 to misdemeanor. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2, 3. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2, 3. Count 4 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Joshua J. Fischer in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Joan Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court review previous activity.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Joshua J. Fischer in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that cases are not resolved, Atty Gerbers needs more time to speak with Defendant, requests status conference. State advises that he thought cases were resolved. Defendant advises that he didn't have time to meet with Atty Gerbers. If not resolved by next hearing, case will be put on trial docket.  Status conference scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua J. Fischer in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers requests a status in September. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers indicates he contacted defendants mother regarding his court appearance this morning. Defendants mother advised defendant has another doctor appt. this morning, should have requested a two week continuance when in court last week. State has no objection to continuance.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.
from Atty Gerbers requesting adjournment.

Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews letter from Atty Gerber requesting adjournment as defendant had doctor appt this moring that was scheduled some time ago. State has no objection to adjournment.  Court reschedules. Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joshua J. Fischer in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Originally set for plea/sentencing. Defense advises of additional charges set for initial appearance Monday morning, requests that case be put off for global resolution.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joshua J. Fischer in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises case is close to resolving.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua J. Fischer in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of additional issue to discuss with State.  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joshua J. Fischer in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense advises that discovery has been received, have meeting to review it on 5/15, requests status in 30 days. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Status conference set for May 11, 2015 at 10:00. Bond continues as is.
by State

Defendant Joshua J. Fischer in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases
by Defendant

Defendant Joshua J. Fischer in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 10:30 am.
by Donald Fischer
No contact direct or indirect with BL, residence at 136 W. Maple St, Sturgeon Bay. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant Joshua J. Fischer appeared by video conference. Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers appeared in person. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 3/9/15, 10:00.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 2/28/15.
